members.name: $relative-image-path-for-uis
members.doc: True to use a relative image path for all new UIs. If true, the path will be "../images/". It can also be a string of the path value. It defaults to false, which means it will look for the images in the ExtJS SDK folder.

members.name: $shadow
members.doc: The box-shadow to use for floated components
members.short_doc: The box-shadow to use for floated components ...

members.name: $shadow-blur-radius
members.doc: The width in pixels by which the specified $shadow-width is blurred to create a soft shadow effect. If set to 0 the shadow will be sharp, the higher the number, the more blurred it will be, and the further out the shadow will extend. For instance a shadow with $shadow-width of 5px that also has a 5px blur radius will be 10px of total shadow..
members.short_doc:
The width in pixels by which the specified $shadow-width is blurred to create a soft
shadow effect. ...

members.name: $shadow-color
members.doc: The color of the shadow in the Modern toolkit. Usually with a transparency element, eg: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4).
members.short_doc: The color of the shadow in the Modern toolkit. ...

members.name: $shadow-width
members.doc: The width in pixels by which shadows exceed their owning component borders all round in the Modern toolkit. A light source direction may be added to skew this in any direction by use of $shadow-x-offset and $shadow-y-offset.
members.short_doc: The width in pixels by which shadows exceed their owning component borders all round in the Modern toolkit. ...

members.name: $shadow-x-offset
members.doc: The X pixel offset by which to shift drop shadows behind floated components in the Modern toolkit. By default, shadows are centered below their component, and spread by $shadow-width pixels.
members.short_doc: The X pixel offset by which to shift drop shadows behind floated components in the Modern toolkit. ...

members.name: $shadow-y-offset
members.doc: The Y pixel offset by which to shift drop shadows behind floated components in the Modern toolkit. By default, shadows are centered below their component, and spread by $shadow-width pixels.
members.short_doc: The Y pixel offset by which to shift drop shadows behind floated components in the Modern toolkit. ...

members.name: $theme-resource-path
members.doc: The base path relative to the CSS output directory to use for theme resources. For example if the theme's images live one directory up from the generated CSS output in a directory named 'foo/images/', you would need to set this variable to '../foo/' in order for the image paths in the CSS output to be generated correctly. By default this is the same as the CSS output directory.
members.short_doc: The base path relative to the CSS output directory to use for theme resources. ...

members.name: $touch-theme-base
background-gradient
members.doc:
Adds a background gradient into a specified selector.

@include background-gradient(#444, 'glossy');

You can also use color-stops if you want full control of the gradient:

@include background-gradient(#444, color-stops(#333, #222, #111));

params.name: $type
params.doc:
The style of the gradient, one of five pre-defined options: matte, bevel, glossy, recessed, or linear:

@include background-gradient(red, 'glossy');

It can also accept a list of color-stop values:;

@include background-gradient(black, color-stops(#333, #111, #000));

Values 'flat' and 'none' will result in no gradient, just flat background-color

members.short_doc: Adds a background gradient into a specified selector. ...

members.name: border
members.doc: Creates a border on an element. If any of the parameters is specified as a list, or if any parameter is null, border-style, border-width, and border-color will be specified as separate properties, otherwise all will be collapsed into a single "border" property.
members.short_doc: Creates a border on an element. ...

members.name: border-bottom
members.doc: Creates a bottom border. If all arguments are non-null they will be collapsed into a single border property.
members.short_doc: Creates a bottom border. ...

members.name: border-left
members.doc: Creates a left border. If all arguments are non-null they will be collapsed into a single border property.
members.short_doc: Creates a left border. ...

members.name: border-right
members.doc: Creates a right border. If all arguments are non-null they will be collapsed into a single border property.
members.short_doc: Creates a right border. ...

members.name: border-side
members.doc: Convenience mixin for border-top, border-right, border-bottom, and border-left
members.short_doc: Convenience mixin for border-top, border-right, border-bottom, and border-left ...

members.name: border-top
members.doc: Creates a top border. If all arguments are non-null they will be collapsed into a single border property.
members.short_doc: Creates a top border. ...

members.name: color-by-background
members.doc:
Colors the text of an element based on lightness of its background.

.my-element {
  @include color-by-background(#fff); // Colors text black.
}

.my-element {
  @include color-by-background(#fff, 40%); // Colors text gray.
}

params.name: $contrast
params.doc: Contrast of text color to its background.

members.short_doc: Colors the text of an element based on lightness of its background. ...

members.name: font
members.doc: Adds a font specification to an element. Uses a single "font" property if possible, otherwise uses separate font-family, font-size, font-weight and line-height properties.
members.short_doc: Adds a font specification to an element. ...

members.name: font-icon
members.doc: Applies a font icon to an element.

params.name: $glyph
params.doc:
A unicode character to use as the icon, or a list specifying the character to use followed by font-size, font-family, and degrees of rotation (90, 180, or 270). All parameters in the list are optional except for glyph. For example, each of the following is valid:

Use the letter "A" as the icon, inherit the font-size from the parent element, and use the default font-family specified by $font-icon-font-family.

.my-icon {
    @include font-icon('\0041');
}

Use the letter "A" as the icon with a font-size of 16px, and the default font-family

.my-icon {
    @include font-icon('\0041' 16px);
}

Use the letter "A" as the icon, inherit font-size, and use FontAwesome as the font-family

.my-icon {
    @include font-icon('\0041' FontAwesome);
}

Use the letter "A" as the icon, inherit font-size, use the default font-family, and rotate the icon 90 degrees clockwise.

.my-icon {
    @include font-icon('\0041' 90);
}

Use the letter "A" as the icon with a 16px font-size, and a FontAwesome as the font-family.

.my-icon {
    @include font-icon('\0041' 16px FontAwesome);
}

Use the letter "A" as the icon with a 16px font-size, default font-family, and rotate the icon 90 degrees clockwise.

.my-icon {
    @include font-icon('\0041' 16px 90);
}

Use the letter "A" as the icon, inherit the font-size, use FontAwesome as the font-family, and rotate the icon 90 degrees clockwise.

.my-icon {
    @include font-icon('\0041' FontAwesome 90);
}

Use the letter "A" as the icon with a font-size of 16px, use FontAwesome as the font-family, and rotate the icon 90 degrees clockwise.

.my-icon {
    @include font-icon('\0041' 16px FontAwesome 90);
}

NOTE: Only numeric values with units are accepted for font-size, e.g. 16px or 2em.

params.name: $pseudo
params.doc: By default this mixin generates a "before" pseudo element ruleset to contain the icon. Set this parameter to "after" to use an after pseudo element. Set to false if you are invoking the font-icon() mixin from within a pseudo element ruleset.

params.name: $line-height
params.doc: Optional line-height to apply to the icon. Pass null to avoid setting line-height and inherit from parent element.

params.name: $style-pseudo
params.doc: By default, font and color styles are placed on the icon-containing element, not the pseudo. This allows for easier customization of font-icons by users since many font-icon generators also place the font styles on the containing element. Set this to true to set font and color styles on the pseudo element instead. This is necessary in cases where the icon-containing element is not exclusively dedicated to containing the icon and may contain other text as well, for example, grid headers and grid grouping headers.

members.short_doc: Applies a font icon to an element. ...

members.name: icon
members.doc: Generates style rules for an icon element

params.name: $icon
params.doc:
A unicode character to use as the icon, or a list specifying the character to use followed by font-family and degrees of rotation (90, 180, or 270). All parameters in the list are optional except for glyph. For example, each of the following is valid:

Use the letter "A" as the icon and use the default font-family

@include font-icon('\0041');

Use the letter "A" as the icon and use FontAwesome as the font-family

@include font-icon('\0041' FontAwesome);

Use the letter "A" as the icon and rotate the icon 90 degrees clockwise.

@include font-icon('\0041' 90);

Use the letter "A" as the icon, use FontAwesome as the font-family, and rotate the icon 90 degrees clockwise.

@include font-icon('\0041' FontAwesome 90);

params.name: $color
params.doc: The color to apply to the element which is containing the icon. See $pseudo-color below

params.name: $size-big
params.doc: The size of the icon element in the big sizing scheme

params.name: $font-size
params.doc: The font-size of the icon. Applied to the :before pseudo element so that it does not affect $size when $size is specified in em units.

params.name: $font-size-big
params.doc: The font-size of the icon in the big sizing scheme. Applied to the :before pseudo element so that it does not affect $size-big when $size-big is specified in em units.

params.name: $style-pseudo
params.doc: Specify as true to apply the $color and $size parameters to the pseudo element which carries the icon rather than to its encapsulating element.

members.short_doc: Generates style rules for an icon element ...

members.name: insertion
members.doc:
Adds basic styles to :before or :after pseudo-elements.

.my-element:after {
  @include insertion(50px, 50px);
}
members.short_doc: Adds basic styles to :before or :after pseudo-elements. ...

members.name: margin
members.doc: Creates a margin on an element. If any item in the list is null it will be excluded.
members.short_doc: Creates a margin on an element. ...

members.name: padding
members.doc: Creates a padding on an element. If any item in the list is null it will be excluded.
members.short_doc: Creates a padding on an element. ...
